intro: Argyreia guichenotii, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often found growing along fences or trees. Its flowers are typically nocturnal, opening at night and closing in the morning. Argyreia guichenotii is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has cultural significance in some indigenous communities.
